intro: Pisonia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate with a rough texture. Pisonia mexicana is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils.
